definition: to snatch (esp related to a robbery)
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: The money was ravished away from him.
The robber grabbed the mobile phone away from the woman.
sentences.chinese: 搶劫犯把那名婦女的手機搶走了。

sentences.english: I feel we've been robbed of two Scudetti.
sentences.chinese: “我感覺我們被搶走了兩個聯賽冠軍”。

sentences.english: The defeated soldiers reaved the villagers of their flocks of sheep.
sentences.chinese: 敗兵搶走了村民的羊羣。

sentences.english: Maybe it takes away from Cath 's dress.
sentences.chinese: 或許這會搶走卡西服裝的丰采。

sentences.english: When late rend away victim Li Cheng wait a student the cellular phone is three and the lump is 47 dollars.
sentences.chinese: 當晚搶走受害人李成等學生手機三部及現金47元。

sentences.english: She pulled a blaster and took Pratuhr's money before escaping through the crowded club.
sentences.chinese: 諾德拔槍搶走了普雷特的錢，然後逃出擁擠的俱樂部。

sentences.english: They took the governor's toupee at the rally.
sentences.chinese: 有人在集會上搶走了州長的假髮。

sentences.english: In the manor the squire told them that Song Jiang, head of the liangshan Marsh, had snatched his daughter away by force.
sentences.chinese: 他們聽說莊主太公說他的女兒被梁山泊首領宋江搶走。

sentences.english: I flew into a rage when another man stole my girlfriend!
sentences.chinese: 女朋友被別人搶走真氣死我了。

sentences.english: The monkey grabbed the peanut out of my hand.
sentences.chinese: 那隻猴子從我手裏搶走了花生。

sentences.english: The enemy soldiers looted the treasures of the art museum.
sentences.chinese: 敵軍士兵搶走了藝術博物館的珍藏。

sentences.english: Film day shortly, her cinematograph was reaved by thief soon.
sentences.chinese: 拍攝日子在即，她的攝影機眼看就被小偷搶走了。

sentences.english: He said they'd turn us into their slaves, they'd steal all our things.
sentences.chinese: 他說他們想把我們變成奴隸，還要搶走我們所有東西。

sentences.english: Auf wiedersehen Lost his place to Tim Howard and took his gloves to Marseille.
sentences.chinese: 被霍華德搶走位置之後就去了馬賽。

sentences.english: He nabbed away the book from my hand.
sentences.chinese: 他從我手中把書搶走了。
